data.title: Mas Bagus Adventure
data.meta_description: 10 posts published by Bagus Widyanto during April 2013
data.text:
Finally, we came to the halfway point of my trip. Not just halfway point, but it is perhaps the highlight of the journey too. Because unlike my previous Malaysia trip, this one features return train trip. Okay, after an enjoyable … Continue reading →

It’s 1st April 2013. Some consider it as “April Fool” day where silly and unfortunate things could happen to anyone. I’m not believer into such things. However, the day proved to be the most unfortunate day of my visit. It … Continue reading →

In the evening we pursued our goal of taking pictures around Marina Bay Sands, and the newly opened Gardens by The Bay. From Bedok interchange, we headed to Paya Lebar where we change to Circle Line MRT. In order to … Continue reading →

After I finished the biking around Bedok reservoir, I took shower, and heading to Orchard road to meet another Singaporean friend: Char Lee. I’ve communicate with him in the internet, but this is the first time I met him in … Continue reading →

Despite the limitation in my uncle and aunt flat, we still enjoyed our stay over there. Although we didn’t enjoy first class accommodation (in fact, we slept on the floor!), but we still able to enjoy our stay. My uncle … Continue reading →

Singapore is well known for its beautiful urban landscape. So we waste no time in photographing them. After returning back to auntie’s flat and having shower and change clothes, we resumed our journey. In our initial plan, we supposed to … Continue reading →

I have a thousand of reasons why I should feel very nervous during my trip to Singapore this time. First, I was held up for prolonged period upon entering Singapore in 2011. So I was afraid if such scenario took … Continue reading →

On the morning of the following day (29th March 2013), we checked out from our hotel and headed straight to KL Sentral station. Eddy also awaited us at KL Sentral, because according to the plan, some railfans would also head … Continue reading →

KL…glorious KL! That’s what pop up on my mind, once we left the airport terminal building. We already purchased the ERL airport train ticket. Since there is no airport railway station at LCCT, the train ticket includes the bus ticket … Continue reading →

Back in October 2012, my friend from Singapore, Suhirman, came to Bandung with his parents and his bride-to-be. They came for holliday and shopping. When they’re about to return back to Singapore, his mother invited me to come to his … Continue reading →
